body_html: I would say this is Python API issue, rather than core TensorFlow issue, since there's no "cond" in TF API, only Switch/Merge. Changing tf.cond to be fully lazy will change behavior​ of existing programs, so it can't be done for backward compatibility reasons. You could write your own version of tf.cond which inserts Switch/Merge in a more intuitive way On Jul 1, 2017 2:29 PM, "3rd3" <notifications@github.com> wrote: But that would still not resolve the paradigm discrepancy between query laziness and branching non-laziness. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#10800 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AABaHOQVanyfGay_1DHuSEmXpIBBKRYKks5sJjvDgaJpZM4N9VuH> .
body_text:
I would say this is Python API issue, rather than core TensorFlow issue,
since there's no "cond" in TF API, only Switch/Merge. Changing tf.cond to
be fully lazy will change behavior​ of existing programs, so it can't be
done for backward compatibility reasons. You could write your own version
of tf.cond which inserts Switch/Merge in a more intuitive way

On Jul 1, 2017 2:29 PM, "3rd3" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

But that would still not resolve the paradigm discrepancy between query
laziness and branching non-laziness.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
<#10800 (comment)>,
or mute the thread
<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AABaHOQVanyfGay_1DHuSEmXpIBBKRYKks5sJjvDgaJpZM4N9VuH>
.
body:
I would say this is Python API issue, rather than core TensorFlow issue,
since there's no "cond" in TF API, only Switch/Merge. Changing tf.cond to
be fully lazy will change behavior​ of existing programs, so it can't be
done for backward compatibility reasons. You could write your own version
of tf.cond which inserts Switch/Merge in a more intuitive way

On Jul 1, 2017 2:29 PM, "3rd3" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

But that would still not resolve the paradigm discrepancy between query
laziness and branching non-laziness.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
